column4: are there any usability people around here whom i can talk to?
so, noone here is into usability?
What do you mean?

well i'm a developer and i work on something, and now i have a hard time deciding how to implement one specific thing, and my solution really sounds bonkers so i thought i'd try to find someone maybe from the openusability project or someone who's into this topic
specifically about how to implement a more advanced Undo / Redo, because the one we're all used to really is terrible
Stefano_: I'm pretty new at Linux, so I might not be the best candidate
:P
if you undo something, then type text, you can't redo. so your version you had a couple of seconds before undoing is lost
thats what annoys me
hmmmm
especially when programming/debugging
it'd probably be a bit annoying.
yes i think so, but as i said it might not be as good as i think
what was your solution? maybe just copy whatever you undid to the clipboard or something
Or you could make a variable or at least the equivalent of a variable in whatever language you are using
and then temporarily store the change you are undoing, and then have redo call it

here's my idea: if you undo, then type, then redo, your chanes get undone step by step until youre at the point before you typed in other text, from then on you have a normal redo, if you can understand that (as i said it sounds bonkers). do you think it would feel right?
Stefano_: It might.
Stefano_: But how about: Make undo store the changes in a variable, then have redo call it from the variable and then clear the variable.
The variable is only used by undo/redo so chances are you won't have problems :P

i take a different approach on undo/redo, i want to save difference-information with every letter you type so that you can go back in time in your document up until the point it was created, even after saving
